I've listed several results that if we got them would be paranormal.=C2=A0 =
I hope to someday get those.=C2=A0 So far, I haven't though.=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=
=A0 Just stories and a lot of "can you hear word X in this recording?"=C2=
=A0 As people have pointed out:

1) People are pretty good at hearing anyth=
ing in noise (like they are good at seeing shapes in clouds), especially if=
 you point it out first.=C2=A0 That's why, for better results, its best not=
 to label your files, or tell people what you expect them to hear.

2) And,=
 of course, you would expect to hear words when scanning the radio dial.

T=
hose don't really test anything paranormal, since they allow a very large s=
ubjective influence.=C2=A0 That's why I try to do experiments to remove tha=
t subjectivity: then we would have results that would make people who quest=
ion the origin of the voices - like me - look stupid.=C2=A0 So I don't know=
 why anyone attack me and my tests, since if they show something paranormal=
, they'd make me look stupid!

Maybe that's the difference between me and t=
he people who always attack me: I am willing to believe in the spirits, or =
not.=C2=A0 Those attaching me because I don't believe like they do will no =
long consider any evidence that does not match their beliefs, and will atta=
ck anyone who questions them.

=C2=A0I still say you're waiting for Slimmer to jump out of a box and slap =

 skeptics. 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0F-S
=C2=A0

On Sun, Aug 22, 2010 at =
4:16 PM, Rj <rasterer@...> wrote:


=C2=A0 







I realize you have=
 plenty of subjective anecdotal evidence.I don't consider that 'hard eviden=
ce' however.=C2=A0 I am looking for something a little more objective and l=
ess subject to influence and interpretations.


And stop putting words in m=
y mouth. A person can misinterpret something, mistake something, or confuse=
 something, without lying about something.=C2=A0 And before you jump down m=
y throat claiming I am saying all results are mistakes, I am not.=C2=A0 I a=
m performing experiments, keeping an open mind, and considering all evidenc=
e I find. 


The way you have been attacking me by calling me names at ever=
y turn, just because I try new things and don't always agree with your worl=
d view, is eerily reminiscent of the way the church of old tried to suppres=
s new thought and discoveries, except you're just substituting the word 'he=
retic' with 'science'. and 'blasphemy' with anything that disagrees with yo=
u.


There's an old saying:=C2=A0 "We become that which we hate".=C2=A0 So =
far, all you've done is denounce people's efforts to try new methods and se=
e what works.=C2=A0 You accept nothing anyone else proposes if it does not =
agree with you.=C2=A0 That is the realm of the extreme skeptic: the same sk=
eptic you ridicule.

=C2=A0
You certainly don't have to agree with my comme=
nts.=C2=A0 And I don't have to agree with yours.=C2=A0 But no one needs all=
 the name calling Frank.=C2=A0=C2=A0 It really adds nothing to support your=
 theories.

ct is facts. Well that's about all there is in this field. Perhaps you shou=
ld take bird watching or something concrete. To not accept what others say =
is the same as calling us all liars, and I find very insulting. 

=C2=A0
=
=C2=A0How irrational is it to ignore all evidence and continuously try to f=
it the phenomon into a diffintion where it will not fit and does not belong=
, and then claim you're looking for a more rational explantation, it just d=
oes not make sense. I say forget the BS "science" whatever that is, puts ou=
t and try thinking on your own.=C2=A0 Mr Spock was a fictional charactor!

I don't think I have en=
ough data yet to make any conclusions, so I plan more experiments.=C2=A0 Si=
nce there are different distinct claims about what the box or the recorders=
 can do, I try to make different distinct experiments for each.


Some peop=
le claim they can get the box to tell them things that the operator couldn'=
t know, so my "whats the object" experiment is one way to examine that.=C2=
=A0 Some people claim the boxes can make predictions, so cataloging predict=
ions and examining the results can help examine that.=C2=A0 If there are ot=
her claims, I will try to figure experiments based on those.

"get outta here" came out, some how. 

=C2=A0

 hard on RJ. I don't know why, but testing doens't seem to work, but we get=

Here is a short =
file, where someone says, "Scamp, Scamp," then Scamp barks. "yap."=C2=A0 Th=
is little dog belonged to my grandma, when I was about 9 or 10 years old, h=
e was a Manchester Terrier, and lived with us for many years, and this is h=
is bark for sure.=C2=A0 I'd know that bark anywhere.=C2=A0 Sorry, that I ca=
n't make it any clearer, I need to get one of those better ghost boxes I gu=
ess.=C2=A0=C2=A0RJ, spirits are just like us, they are not omnipresent like=
 God,=C2=A0=C2=A0probably why David doesn't want to play the guessing game,=
 he has better things to do over there, and has said, they have thousands o=
f people standing in this long line waiting to get into the Heavens, and He=
 can't just drop His job and go to your house to see what you have over the=
re, He did tell me that first time what it was, and i sent it to you, but i=
t was too late.=C2=A0 It's hard for me to understand them sometimes, He was=
 also right about that little boy, Syler being killed, and where his body w=
ould be
 found, I don't know what they did about it though. sf
